title: The Very best of Steptoe and son
brief_description: The world’s most famous rag and bone men in five great episodes (some black and white, some colour). In “Upstairs, downstairs, upstairs, downstairs”, Albert is upstairs, flat on his back as he has slipped a disk. Harold has been giving him the very best of care as he heals very slowly. Meanwhile Harold is doing the round by himself - until he notices the strange disappearance of all the pink licorice allsorts from downstairs. In “The Bath”, Harold invites a ‘bird’ for cocktails and arrives home to find his Dad eating pickles in the bath in the middle of the lounge room. A bit of a social stigma, to say the least. “Porn yesterday” sees Harold discover an old ‘What the butler saw’ machine on his round, he problem arises when the vicar thinks it is just the thing for the forthcoming fete. “Sceance in a wet rag and bone yard” with guest stars Patricia Routledge, finds there is spirits all around and half a bottle of it is in Albert. In “And so to bed”, Harold’s success with women hits rock bottom when the willing Marcia discovers insects in his bed. He then takes drastic action and buys a waterbed in the hope of enticing her back…
